text: Donald Kent "Deke" Slayton (March 1, 1924 â€“ June 13, 1993) was a United States Air Force pilot, aeronautical engineer, and test pilot who was selected as one of the original NASA Mercury Seven astronauts. He went on to become NASA's first Chief of the Astronaut Office and Director of Flight Crew Operations. Slayton died on June 13, 1993 in League City, Texas from brain cancer, aged 69. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:1993 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:American astronauts Category:Scientists from Wisconsin
title: Deke Slayton
